t: The Lord Helps His Troubled People
A Psalm of David when he fled from Absalom his son.
Lord,*spn how they have increased who trouble me! Many*ld are*i they who rise up against me.
Many*ld are*i they who say of me, “There*ild is*i no help for him in God.” Selah*ipg
But*pn You, O Lord,*s are*i a shield for me, My*ld glory and the One who lifts up my head.
I*ld cried to the Lord*s with my voice, And*ld He heard me from His holy hill. Selah*ipg
I*pn lay down and slept; I*ld awoke, for the Lord*s sustained me.
I*ld will not be afraid of ten thousands of people Who*ld have set themselves*i against me all around.
Arise,*ln O Lord;*s Save*ld me, O my God! For*ld You have struck all my enemies on the cheekbone; You*ld have broken the teeth of the ungodly.
Salvation*ld belongs*i to the Lord.*s Your*ld blessing is*i upon Your people. Selah*ipg
